feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Flood Warning issued September 09 at 11:51AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT MONDAY FOR KENAI RIVER NEAR COOPER LANDING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by the Snow Glacier-dammed lake outburst continues. * WHERE...Kenai River near Cooper Landing through Skilak Lake. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Monday.

entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT MONDAY ALONG KENAI RIVER... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a glacier-dammed lake outburst is expected. * WHERE...Kenai River near below Skilak Lake, including Kenai Keys. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Monday.

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued September 09 at 4:08AM AKDT until September 10 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...East winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph expected. * WHERE...Upper Koyukuk Valley, mainly higher elevations along the Dalton Highway. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 4 AM AKDT Sunday.

entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...South winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range passes. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 10 AM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued September 08 at 11:47AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR MARICOPA COUNTY INCLUDING THE PHOENIX METRO AREA SATURDAY... The Arizona Department of Environmental Quality (ADEQ) has issued an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for the Phoenix Metro Area on Saturday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued September 09 at 10:32AM AST until September 09 at 5:00PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heat indices values of 108 to 111 degrees Fahrenheit. * WHERE...The urban and low lying areas along the northern coast from Aguadilla to Fajardo, eastern interior, Vieques, Culebra, and St. Croix. * WHEN...Thru 5 PM AST this afternoon.

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued September 09 at 10:31AM AST until September 11 at 8:00PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 PM AST MONDAY... * WHAT...Life-threatening rip currents due to breaking waves of 6 and 10 feet, and occasionally higher. * WHERE...Beaches along St Croix Eastern Half.
